alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 2:56PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bureau and Putnam Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 256 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tiskilwa, or 10 miles south of Princeton, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hennepin, Spring Valley, DePue, Granville, Ladd, Tiskilwa, Dalzell, Bureau Junction, Putnam, Mark, Seatonville, Standard, Hollowayville, Ottville, Lake Thunderbird, Florid, and Lone Tree Corners. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 68 and 72. Interstate 180 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
